Lights
Your
paintbrush
shows it to you by casting a shadow which must always follow the
back of your hand
, not in a straight line like this
, for the light would be too crude & too harsh, but obliquely & as if at an incline, thus
. It is necessary that the panel not be facing the
light
head-on, but half turned against it. And above all look for soft light, for it makes soft both the shadow & the work, as a harsh light a harsh work.
